titleStmt.title: A work for none but angels & men that is to be able to look into and to know ourselves, or a book shewing what the soule is, subsisting and having its operations without the body ... : of the imagination or common sense, the phantasie, sensative memory, passions, motion of life, the local motion, intellectual power of the soul ... Thomas Jenner has lineas composuit.
titleStmt.author: Davies, John, Sir, 1569-1626.
Jenner, Thomas, fl. 1631-1656.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by M.S. for Thomas Jenner,

notesStmt.note: Prose version of Sir John Davies' poem Nosce te ipsum--LCCP.
Includes "What heaven is, vindicated from the vulgar mistakes and gross conceivings of many" (p. 29-39) which is attributed to Thomas Jenner by LCCP.
Reproduction of original in the Huntington Library.
